column2: MONTANA DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column4: Montana

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Honk your horn.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column8: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 2. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column4: in cold, dry weather.
column6: when tire marks have beenÂ left by other vehicles.
column8: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp left turn
column8: No U-turn

column2: 4. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
column4: use your emergency lights.
column8: flash your headlights.

column2: 5. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: number of cars in front of you.
column8: presence of a yield sign.
column10: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.

column2: 6. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Drink coffee before driving.
column6: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column8: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
column10: Take a cold shower before driving.

column2: 7. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

column2: 8. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before the traffic light turns red.
column8: after you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 9. Before backing up, you should:
column4: flash your headlights.
column6: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column8: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column10: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 10. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the right lane must go straight.

column2: 11. A good rule for passing is:
column4: drive with the flow of traffic and pass only as needed.
column6: pass on the right whenever possible.
column8: try to get to the front of any line of slow moving traffic as soon as possible.
column10: always remember to flash your lights and sound your horn to alert the other drivers that you are about to pass.

column2: 12. The most common cause of traffic crashes is:
column4: wet pavement.
column8: human error.

column2: 13. If two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time:
column4: both vehicles must stop.
column6: the driver on the left must signal the driver on the right to go.
column8: the vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.
column10: the vehicle on the right must yield to the vehicle on the left.

column2: 14. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Side Road
column8: Crossroads ahead

column2: 16. You are approaching an intersection when the signal turns yellow. You should:
column4: stop then enter the intersection when safe to do so.
column6: speed up to get through the intersection before the red light comes on.
column8: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.

column2: 17. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: merge to the left.
column6: slow down at the traffic signal.
column8: stop before the intersection.
column10: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.

column2: 18. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: High emphasis warning.
column8: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 19. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column8: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column10: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 20. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column8: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.

column2: 21. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: there are four stop signs at this intersection.

column2: 22. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column6: the lane to the right may pass.
column8: passing is permitted in either direction.
column10: the lane to the left may pass.

column2: 23. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 24. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: always obey signs and traffic signals.
column6: expect trains on any track at any time.
column8: never drive around lowered crossing gates.

column2: 25. When you need to change lanes, it is important to:
column4: signal your intentions ahead of time.
column8: make sure the lane you are about to enter is clear.

column2: 26. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Law
column8: Warnings

column2: 27. When driving on roads that may be slippery:
column4: do not make any sudden changes in direction or speed.
column8: use cruise control to maintain a steady speed.
column10: always drive at the highest speed allowed.

column2: 28. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: wear approved helmets.

column2: 29. What does a red arrow on a traffic light mean?
column4: You may turn in the direction of the arrow.
column6: You may proceed slowly through the intersection.
column8: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column10: You must stop. Do not go in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

column2: 30. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column8: the road ahead is narrow.
column10: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: No turns are allowed on this road
column8: Right lane closed

column2: 32. This sign means:
column4: You must stop ahead
column6: There is a traffic signal ahead
column8: Railroad crossing ahead

column2: 33. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: soft shoulder
column8: truck

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: No turns are allowed on this road
column8: Right lane closed

column2: 32. This sign means:
column4: You must stop ahead
column6: There is a traffic signal ahead
column8: Railroad crossing ahead

column2: 33. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: soft shoulder
column8: truck
